title: Why do d-block elements make coordination compounds? - Quora

response.answer_text: The cations of d-block elements have strong tendency to form complexes with certain molecules (e.g.CO,NO,NH3 ...etc) or ions (e.g.F-,Cl−,CN−) called ligands. Their tendency to form complexes is due to two reasons. Small size and high positive charge density of ions of transition metals. Presence of vacant (n−1)d orbitals which are of appropriate energy to accept one pair and unshared pair of electrons from the ligands for bonding with them. e.g. of some complex compounds are: [Cu(NH3)4]2+ ,[Ag(NH3)2]+ ,[Fe(CN)6]4- ...etc.
d block elements form coordination compounds easily because they have high ionic potential as well as availablity of vacant orbitals However elements of other block also form coordination compounds
